event.title: Denmark Premiere of the Ada & Zangemann Film in Aarhus, Denmark

body.p: Join us for an inspiring day in the spirit of free and open-source software! The Danish branch of the Free Software Foundation Europe (FSFE-DK) invites you to the premiere of the Danish version of the animated film "Ada & Zangemann" at the Øst for Paradis cinema in Aarhus on 27th March from 15:00 to 17:00. The event starts at 13:00 (CEST) with a screening of the film for schools only and opens its doors to all interested people at 15:00 (CEST). ”Ada & Zangemann – A Tale of Software, Skateboards, and Raspberry Ice Cream” was originally created as a children's book in 2021 by Matthias Kirschner, the president of the Free Software Foundation Europe (FSFE). It is a story that conveys the need for the right to use, share, study, and improve software in a way that is easy to understand for both children and adults. It is an optimistic story about innovation and technological independence, which is highly relevant today.

After the film, there will be a panel discussion featuring Matthias Kirschner, the author of ”Ada & Zangemann,” where we will discuss the film’s message in relation to topics such as the need for free and open-source software in schools and its role in both public and private sectors. Participation is completely free.
